parse: Personal / Relative Pronoun - Nominative Masculine Plural
Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: From timios; to prize, i.e. Fix a valuation upon; by implication, to revere.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative 1st Person Plural
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
A price, honor. From tino; a value, i.e. Money paid, or valuables; by analogy, esteem, or the dignity itself.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Middle - 3rd Person Plural
str2: To put, place upon, lay on; I add, give in addition. From epi and tithemi; to impose.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From the base of chraomai or chre; employment, i.e. An affair; also occasion, demand, requirement or destitution.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Middle or Passive - Dative Masculine Plural
str2: From ana and ago; to lead up; by extension to bring out; specially, to sail away.
